video.title: The New Detectives: Case Studies in Forensic Science
video.synopsis: Real-life forensic scientists solve baffling crimes by using a wide range of techniques to investigate the tiniest and most obscure of clues.

episodes.synopsis: The Texas Rangers earn their reputation as tireless agents of justice as they hunt criminals across the expansive Lone Star State.
episodes.title: Texas Rangers

episodes.synopsis: Detectives attempt to stop a voracious serial killer who grows bolder with every attack while the body count rises.
episodes.title: Body Count

episodes.synopsis: Investigators revisit past cases in which a culprit left a critical clue at the crime scene that only forensic science could find.
episodes.title: Lasting Impressions

episodes.synopsis: Investigators follow forensic clues to stop terror suspects, including the first World Trade Center bombers and a man plotting against the IRS.
episodes.title: Living in Terror

episodes.synopsis: When family members kill, detectives look behind closed doors in search of secrets that could lead them to a motive.
episodes.title: Family Plots

episodes.synopsis: When other clues are scarce, searchable databases filled with fingerprints can be the key to solving tough-to-crack cases.
episodes.title: Death Grip

episodes.synopsis: When no human witness to a crime can be found, nature can provide forensic scientists with clues in the form of insects and microbes.
episodes.title: Natural Witness

episodes.synopsis: Handwriting analysis plays a critical role in solving crimes, sussing out everything from document forgeries to fake suicide notes.
episodes.title: Signed in Blood

episodes.synopsis: This episode chronicles three cases that were solved by unexpected evidence after detectives exhausted seemingly major clues.
episodes.title: Unlikely Sources

episodes.synopsis: Toxicologists balance known science with physical evidence in three high-profile cases of death by apparent poisoning.
episodes.title: Lethal Dosage

episodes.synopsis: Detectives reveal how they see through crime scenes that have been altered to look like a suicide or to frame an innocent party.
episodes.title: Dead Wrong

episodes.synopsis: When the scene of the crime is devoid of clues, forensic investigators turn to the victim's body to find evidence.
episodes.title: Grave Discoveries

episodes.synopsis: Journalists, crime writers and law enforcement agents discuss how the narrative of a murder case unfolds as the evidence is examined.
episodes.title: True Crime

episodes.synopsis: Investigators use cutting-edge technology to investigate a suspicious drug overdose and an incident of cyanide poisoning.
episodes.title: Bad Medicine

episodes.synopsis: Investigators examine specific traits of tools and weapons that can lead to a culprit's identity when they're used to commit murder.
episodes.title: Tools of Death

episodes.synopsis: Investigators use a variety of forensic techniques to turn up clues in arson crime scenes, even in the ashes left behind.
episodes.title: From the Ashes

episodes.synopsis: Investigators reveal the inherent difficulties (and rewards) of solving cold cases with evidence discovered years after the original crime took place.
episodes.title: Cold Cases

episodes.synopsis: Researchers reveal the microscopic evidence used to identify murderers, and discuss how the tiniest clues can solve the toughest cases.
episodes.title: Traces of Guilt

episodes.synopsis: Solving murders in a modern age depends on detectives who specialize in searching computers, phones and other forms of technology for clues.
episodes.title: Electronic Witness

episodes.synopsis: Though less likely to kill, women do commit murder, as in the cases of Barbara Stager, Blanche Taylor Moore and Sylvia White, profiled in this episode.
episodes.title: Women Who Kill

episodes.synopsis: Investigators scour every inch of a crime scene and turn up unlikely bits of evidence that can lead them straight to the murderer.
episodes.title: Remnant of Blame

episodes.synopsis: Detectives review past cases with the help of recently developed technologies, including the intriguing new technique of brain fingerprinting.
episodes.title: Infallible Witness

episodes.synopsis: Detectives delve into cases of spouses who commit murder, including the death of Rebecca Vargas at the hands of her husband, Stephen.
episodes.title: Broken Vows

episodes.synopsis: Detectives investigate cases in which passion or obsession led to murder, including a high-profile double homicide that sparked a global manhunt.
episodes.title: Lethal Obsession

episodes.synopsis: Detectives reveal how they proceed in cases where a victim is missing and presumed dead, but no body has been found.
episodes.title: Presumed Dead

episodes.synopsis: Forensic scientists must battle charred and waterlogged physical evidence as they investigate cases of arson.
episodes.title: Flames of Justice

episodes.synopsis: What drives someone to become a paid assassin in a case of murder for hire? Is it all about the money ... or something more?
episodes.title: Deadly Dealings

episodes.synopsis: Investigators apply the principles of decomposition to determine a victim's time of death, from hours to even decades before.
episodes.title: Dead Men Do Talk

episodes.synopsis: Criminal profilers reveal how detectives get into the minds of notorious serial killers like John Wayne Gacy and Richard Chase.
episodes.title: Mind Hunters

episodes.synopsis: Investigators discuss the challenges of missing persons cases and review three disappearances, including a parental abduction.
episodes.title: Without a Trace

episodes.synopsis: Subtle killers who choose poison as their murder weapon are often two-faced monsters who take advantage of their victims' trust.
episodes.title: Tainted Trust

episodes.synopsis: When arsonists, bombers and weapons traffickers commit crimes, agents from the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives are on the case.
episodes.title: Federal Offense

episodes.synopsis: Investigators discuss fiber analysis and the critical clues that can be found in carpet and clothing fibers, hair or even eyelashes.
episodes.title: Shreds of Evidence

episodes.synopsis: The detectives discern the motives behind murder for hire and find that money is typically at the heart of it.
episodes.title: Blood Money

episodes.synopsis: Coroners reveal how every inch of a murder victim's body can provide essential clues to track down the killer.
episodes.title: Coroner’s Casebook

episodes.synopsis: Forensic detectives put their senses to the test to investigate poisonings, which are typically carried out by an acquaintance.
episodes.title: A Taste of Poison

episodes.synopsis: New research in the fields of forensic botany and geology has given investigators new tools to help them track down killers.
episodes.title: Seeds of Destruction

episodes.synopsis: Detectives work to catch a trio of cold, calculating serial killers before they add new victims to their growing list of victims.
episodes.title: Murder by Numbers

episodes.synopsis: Clear motives like money or obsession often lead detectives straight to a murderer. But what about those who kill just for the thrill of it?
episodes.title: Scattered Clues

episodes.synopsis: Investigators tackle three murder cases in which there weren't any bodies to work with, only forensic data at the scene of the crime.
episodes.title: Bodies of Evidence
